summary: "Mary Poppins" is a classic 1964 Disney musical film directed by Robert Stevenson and produced by Walt Disney. It stars Julie Andrews as Mary Poppins, a magical nanny who helps a dysfunctional London family. The movie combines live-action and animation and features catchy songs by the Sherman Brothers. It was a huge success, earning over $103 million worldwide and winning five Academy Awards, including Best Actress for Julie Andrews. The film is now considered a cultural treasure and was added to the U.S. National Film Registry in 2013.
title: Mary Poppins (film)
